metadata.description: Access Control - Identity, authentication, authorization, account management

controls.Name: AC-1-a - Policy and Procedures

control.description: Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]:
requirements: [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] access control policy that:
(a) Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance;
(b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines;
Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and the associated access controls.

controls.discussion: Access control policy and procedures address the controls in the AC family that are implemented within systems and organizations. The risk management strategy is an important factor in establishing such policies and procedures. Policies and procedures contribute to security and privacy assurance. Therefore, it is important that security and privacy programs collaborate on the development of access control policy and procedures. Security and privacy program policies and procedures at the organization level are preferable, in general, and may obviate the need for mission- or system-specific policies and procedures. Procedures can be established for security and privacy programs, for mission or business processes, and for systems, if needed. Procedures describe how the policies or controls are implemented and can be directed at the individual or role that is the object of the procedure. Procedures can be documented in system security and privacy plans or in one or more separate documents. Events that may precipitate an update to access control policy and procedures include assessment or audit findings, security incidents or breaches, or changes in laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines. Simply restating controls does not constitute an organizational policy or procedure.

aws_function_mapping.manual_details: Review access control policies, procedures, and documentation for completeness and accuracy. Validate that policies address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination, and compliance requirements.
aws_function_mapping.coverage_notes: This control requires organizational policy development and cannot be automated through AWS functions alone.

controls.Name: AC-1-b - Policy and Procedures

control.description: Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the access control policy and procedures.
requirements: Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the access control policy and procedures.

controls.discussion: Access control policy and procedures address the controls in the AC family that are implemented within systems and organizations. The risk management strategy is an important factor in establishing such policies and procedures. Policies and procedures contribute to security and privacy assurance. Therefore, it is important that security and privacy programs collaborate on the development of access control policy and procedures. Security and privacy program policies and procedures at the organization level are preferable, in general, and may obviate the need for mission- or system-specific policies and procedures. Procedures can be established for security and privacy programs, for mission or business processes, and for systems, if needed. Procedures describe how the policies or controls are implemented and can be directed at the individual or role that is the object of the procedure. Procedures can be documented in system security and privacy plans or in one or more separate documents. Events that may precipitate an update to access control policy and procedures include assessment or audit findings, security incidents or breaches, or changes in laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines. Simply restating controls does not constitute an organizational policy or procedure.

aws_function_mapping.manual_details: Review organizational structure to ensure designated officials are assigned for access control policy management. Document roles and responsibilities.
aws_function_mapping.coverage_notes: Organizational role assignment cannot be automated through AWS functions.

controls.Name: AC-1-c - Policy and Procedures

control.description: Review and update the current access control:
requirements: Policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events];
Procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

controls.discussion: Access control policy and procedures address the controls in the AC family that are implemented within systems and organizations. The risk management strategy is an important factor in establishing such policies and procedures. Policies and procedures contribute to security and privacy assurance. Therefore, it is important that security and privacy programs collaborate on the development of access control policy and procedures. Security and privacy program policies and procedures at the organization level are preferable, in general, and may obviate the need for mission- or system-specific policies and procedures. Procedures can be established for security and privacy programs, for mission or business processes, and for systems, if needed. Procedures describe how the policies or controls are implemented and can be directed at the individual or role that is the object of the procedure. Procedures can be documented in system security and privacy plans or in one or more separate documents. Events that may precipitate an update to access control policy and procedures include assessment or audit findings, security incidents or breaches, or changes in laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines. Simply restating controls does not constitute an organizational policy or procedure.

aws_function_mapping.manual_details: Establish and maintain process for regular review and updates of access control policies and procedures. Document review frequency and triggers.
aws_function_mapping.coverage_notes: Policy review processes require organizational oversight and cannot be fully automated.

controls.Name: AC-2-a - Account Management

control.description: Define and document the types of accounts allowed and specifically prohibited for use within the system.

controls.discussion: Examples of system account types include individual, shared, group, system, guest, anonymous, emergency, developer, temporary, and service. Identification of authorized system users and the specification of access privileges reflect the requirements in other controls in the security plan. Users requiring administrative privileges on system accounts receive additional scrutiny by organizational personnel responsible for approving such accounts and privileged access. Types of accounts that organizations may wish to prohibit due to increased risk include shared, group, emergency, anonymous, temporary, and guest accounts. Where access involves personally identifiable information, security programs collaborate with the senior agency official for privacy. Temporary and emergency accounts are intended for short-term use, with procedures for disabling or removing them when no longer needed. Organizations may define access privileges or other attributes by account or type. Inactivity, termination, or policy violations are conditions for account disabling.

aws_function_mapping.manual_details: Review and validate account type definitions, document prohibited account types, and ensure policies are enforced.
aws_function_mapping.coverage_notes: AWS functions can inventory and review existing accounts, but policy definition requires manual review.

controls.Name: AC-2-b - Account Management
controls.discussion: Examples of system account types include individual, shared, group, system, guest, anonymous, emergency, developer, temporary, and service. Identification of authorized system users and the specification of access privileges reflect the requirements in other controls in the security plan. Users requiring administrative privileges on system accounts receive additional scrutiny by organizational personnel responsible for approving such accounts and privileged access. Types of accounts that organizations may wish to prohibit due to increased risk include shared, group, emergency, anonymous, temporary, and guest accounts. Where access involves personally identifiable information, security programs collaborate with the senior agency official for privacy. Temporary and emergency accounts are intended for short-term use, with procedures for disabling or removing them when no longer needed. Organizations may define access privileges or other attributes by account or type. Inactivity, termination, or policy violations are conditions for account disabling.

aws_function_mapping.manual_details: Review account manager assignments, ensure proper role assignments, and validate accountability structure.
aws_function_mapping.coverage_notes: AWS functions can identify existing users, but manager assignment requires manual review.

new_functions_suggested.description: Validate that IAM policies follow least privilege principles with detailed analysis
new_functions_suggested.purpose: Enhanced least privilege validation for AC-6 compliance

new_functions_suggested.description: Validate separation of duties across IAM roles and policies
new_functions_suggested.purpose: Enhanced separation of duties validation for AC-5 compliance

new_functions_suggested.description: Check access control policy compliance across all AWS services
new_functions_suggested.purpose: Comprehensive access control policy validation for AC-1 compliance

new_functions_suggested.description: Validate account lifecycle automation and processes
new_functions_suggested.purpose: Enhanced account management validation for AC-2 compliance
